summary: This document outlines a request for the Document Conversion Laboratory to assist in scanning and automating telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document details the handling of evidence and the processing of records in support of the ongoing investigation into Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is the subject of an obstruction of justice case and was previously employed by Jeffrey Epstein. He possessed an address book with names and numbers of potential underage victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the central figure in the child prostitution case, and his activities are under investigation. Rodriguez's possession of an address book is linked to Epstein.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager and butler for Epstein.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims instead of turning it over to law enforcement.
The address book is believed to contain information related to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.
Rodriguez's case was opened in October 2009, indicating ongoing investigations into Epstein's activities.
